Mini 1570: North Sea Winter's Bite

Conceived and Designed by Smudger
Moderated by fferyllt
Backup Moderator - Cabd
Reviewed for Normalcy and Balance by Empking, Cogito Ergo Sum and LlamaFluff



A quiet fishing village nestles within the cliffs of a remote part of Northwestern Europe. So remote that its only access from land is via a picturesque winding narrow road. The village had remained remote for years but now was becoming an ideal stop over point for summer tourism. This of course bought a growth to its income and growing economic stability.

But that was during the summer. Now, in the middle of the bleak winter, things were gravely different. The road offered only a dangerous and perilous journey through snow and ice and was often blocked to all but the foolhardy. The seas were rough and dangerous often closing the small harbor as huge waves crashed into the outer sea defenses.

Now on a dark and forlorn night you and the rest of the town council gather to discuss how best to use the summer income to meet the challenges of these bleak winters. As you arrive in the town hall meeting room there is the sound of a gunshot from the floor above.

Everyone rushes to the first floor where a gruesome sight is discovered. In the dark confined space of the communications and telephone exchange room, slumped over his desk, is the communications technician with a bullet hole in his head. It is also clear that those responsible did not want word to get out as all the communications equipment in the room had been sabotaged and is unusable.

It seems impossible, but winter is suddenly even darker and colder than before. Summer plans are forgotten as you realize your very survival is threatened in this bleak isolation.

LinksDay 4: post #1013

Rules


Respect each other. Intolerance will not be tolerated.

Play to your win condition.

Do not quote private Moderator-supplied information (either real or fabricated) of any kind. Paraphrasing (for role claims, etc.) is acceptable.

Do not communicate outside of the forum postings unless your role PM specifically allows it. Mafia members may communicate at night and during the confirmation stage.

If you have a role with an action your choices are due to me by the posted deadline or as detailed in your Role PM. If I do not receive your choice via PM or bolded in the quick-topic provided by the posted deadline you will forfeit your actions.

Any player with a Night action may instead submit a “No Action” PM to let the Mod know that you do not want to perform your expected action that Night phase.

I reserve the right to make any changes to the rules at any time. My word is law.

Abusing exploits or loopholes will not be tolerated.

This is a normal game.

Voting, Deadlines, and Player Death

A simple majority of all living members must agree on one person for a lynch to occur prior to deadline.

Once you have reached a simple majority no further unvoting will change someone’s fate.

Once a player is lynched the game enters twilight until I post a death scene; all players including the one who was lynched may continue to post during twilight.

Please submit votes as: Vote: PlayerName or VOTE: PlayerName. Votes will NOT be counted if they are not bold! Obvious abbreviations or nicknames will be counted so long as they are unambiguous.

Please submit vote revocations as either Unvote: PlayerName or Unvote. Unvotes are not required, but are helpful.

You may Vote: No Lynch - a simple majority of these vote types are required to send the game to Night phase without a lynch.

This game will have 2 week deadlines. At deadline, if there is not a simple majority of votes there will be No Lynch.

I will post vote counts as often as possible, at least once a day (excluding possible holidays).

Deadlines may be extended to account for holidays or site disruption.

Miscellaneous/Mechanics:

Dark Blue is my color. You're free to use other colors as you see fit, but using Dark Blue will count as impersonating the mod.

No hidden text or cryptography.

If you have an issue/problem with the game, please PM me privately. Do not post issues/complaints in the game thread.

I may make mistakes - please point out any mistakes gently. Mistakes will be corrected where possible, but sometimes mistakes are made that cannot be reversed. These will stand as final to be commiserated over after the game.
Please bold all requests to the Mod so that they don’t get missed.

Prods of missing players will be issued automatically after 72 hours of no activity or upon request after 48 hours of no activity. A prodded player has 48 hours to respond or risks replacement. A player who has been prodded 3 times is subject to replacement without further notice.

Rule violations will be dealt with according to their severity, up to and including a Modkill.

If you anticipate being unavailable for more than a 48-hour period please post a notice to that effect in the thread.

If you think you may need to be replaced, notify me as soon as possible.

Remember, this is a normal setup, so there are at least 2 mafia members and one vanilla townie. Here is a sample Role PM:

Welcome!

You are a Vanilla Townie

You have no special abilities. You win when all non-town aligned factions have been eliminated.

Please Confirm by sending me a PM saying /confirm and your Role Name.

Game Thread Link:
Role PMs will go out tomorrow morning. Stay tuned!

All role PMs have been sent. The thread will open and game will start when 11 of 13 players have confirmed via PM.

Current Count 10/13

24 hours have passed and we're one player short of the necessary 11 to start.

I'm going to PM the players who haven't responded yet and give it a few more hours before searching for replacements.

Sorry for the delay. Hopefully the game will be open and started later today.

There's a difference between making assumptions and scumhunting. Your reasoning on SKOT is fine, because it's backed up in logic. But there is no inherent reason to suspect that scum had a pr read on wolfy. Or that scum shot him for his reads. Or that scum won't bus. Those are all just brute statements. They are quite possibly true, but there are other explanations. The assumption that scum won't bus isn't necessarily a bad thing (it just shows an underlying pattern of you assuming things that have no reason to be assumed). The other assumptions you're making, however, make no sense - scum could have shot wolfy because they thought he was some random pr. Or because they were afraid of his reads. Or because they thought he was the dayvig. Or because they didn't want a relatively fresh replacement to add more input. Or because they wanted to shoot someone who hadn't said much to prevent telling the town too much.

I would in fact say there is reason to suspect that the reason is *not* because of his reads, because he had been pretty lurky for his time here, so even with accurate reads he probably wouldn't be a large threat (I also have reason to say that because I'm town and I think Victor is town). It's quite possible that it was because they thought he was a PR, but I see no reason to presume that it was.

As a general rule starting from things like NK analysis or bandwagon analysis is a bad idea. They're a great tool for supplementing direct scumhunting, but they should not be used as a starting point for getting reads. I don't think those assumptions are necessarily scummy either, but they're certainly a bad thing to have.

In post 653, FakeGod wrote:I'm amused.

Tell me how a "case" would help town.

Many ways.

1) It can help convince other townies that you're right. If you have a correct scumread and a good enough case, then you can convince other people to vote with you.

2) Alternatively, if you're wrong, then you can open up opportunity for others to criticize your case, which can disavow you of incorrect reads. So making cases can both help your own reads and help others' reads.

3) It can elicit reactions from the accused. Different kinds of defensiveness or other reactions can be indicative of scum, or indicative of townies who were wrongly accused. Towns live on information; reactions to cases are just one more kind of information that can be useful for scumhunting.

4) It can help others read the person making the case. If someone makes a case that looks completely fabricated, or that looks as if the case was being made for the sake of pushing on a given person rather than as a response to that person's behavior (i.e., that scum wanted to push on person X so they made up a case on person X, rather than town who looked at person X, decided they were scummy then made a case), they are more likely to be scum. If someone makes a case with new insights that appear genuine, then they can be more likely to be town.

5) It can help with partner reads in the future. If person A makes a case on person B, and one of the two later flips scum, the case can be evaluated to decide if it was likely to be an instance of bussing.
